coderX: Then don't whine on Pirate Bay about it. Whine to Microsoft for not supporting one of the greatest A/V-containers that's available. It may be that others support most of the features and audio-/videocodecs in an MKV-file, but AFAIK, no other container (MP4, MPG, AVI, OGG, etc) has ALL the features and compatibility of MKV.

Or.... There's supposed to be a program called XBMC that apparently ANYONE can load onto their XBox and play pretty much EVERYTHING digital media-related under the sun. Then, no need to convert your movies from MKV.

Could someone please explain to me why the size of this movie varies so much?  If you search for HiRes-Movies: Deathly Hallows the top 10 downloads vary anywhere from less the 1 GB to over 10 GB, all claiming to be 720p (one 1080p and just under 12 GB).  I can't figure out why there is so much variation, a few hundred MBs depending on editing and encoding makes sense, but not a difference of 10 GB.  Can anyone explain this to me?
